column4: Hello.. I installed ubuntu 11.04 on an Asus Eee Pc 1015pe and the wireless card (RT3090) is not functioning. It is recognized by ubuntu in lspci but the networkmanager refuses to start the wireless device.. can anyone help me?
any drivers maybe that i have to install?
use hardware and drivers
okay checking it now
i cant find anything listing "hardware and drivers"... I only found "additional drivers" in the control center
love4linux: i meant in system->administration->
love4linux: hardware drivers
strange...there is nothing there as well
maybe I should install a package for that?
yes, im on older version
okay brb to install that
the only application that I found about listing hardware is lshw-gtk... is that the one you are talking about?
let me check
how would this application help me fix my wireless NIC? shouldn't I check if the module for the wireless card is loaded in the kernele?
love4linux: have you installed the driver ?
emm no I havent but I searched in synaptic for ralink or rt3090 and it didnt come up with anything... do you know the name of the driver for this wireless nic?
check it
love4linux: lspci -k
check your nic is using which module
I found a threat in ubuntu's forum about this wnic and i have to install proprietary drivers from ralink
I will do that I ll check back with you
